p: Ficus exasperata Vahl-Holl (Moraceae) leaves in West Africa are used for the treatment of infectious diseases and inflammatory conditions. However, a more thorough phytochemical analysis of the ethnomedicinal uses of F. exasperata has identified new compounds: apigenin C-8 glucoside, isoquercitrin-6- O-4-hydroxybenzoate, and quercetin-3- O- Î²- rhamnoside, as some of the constituents of this plant that inhibited the growth of Gram-positive organisms only [ 64].
